meanings.definition: The growth or movement of an organism in response to gravity.
meanings.sent1: The geotropisms of the plant roots help them grow downwards towards the soil.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study geotropisms to understand how plants adapt to their environment.
meanings.sent3: The geotropisms of the tree made it look like it was reaching out for a hug from the ground.
meanings.sent4: The geotropisms of the vines climbing the wall resembled nature's own form of gravity art.
meanings.sent5: Watching the geotropisms of the sunflowers turning towards the sun is like witnessing a slow dance of nature.

meanings.definition: The tendency of plants to grow in a particular direction in response to gravity.
meanings.sent1: The farmer observed the geotropisms of the corn plants as they reached for the sky.
meanings.sent2: Gardening books often discuss how to encourage geotropisms in houseplants.
meanings.sent3: The geotropisms of the tomato plant made it seem like it was trying to escape the garden.
meanings.sent4: The geotropisms of the ivy creeping along the fence created a natural green curtain.
meanings.sent5: The geotropisms of the daisies leaning towards the sunlight painted a beautiful picture in the garden.
